intro: Trichostephania chevalieri, commonly known as the Malabar sarsaparilla, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by berries that turn red when mature. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is valued for its medicinal properties. The leaves and roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
